intro: Helianthella quinquenervis var. arizonica, commonly known as Arizona sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a perennial herb with a hairy stem and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. It typically grows in rocky soils and dry habitats, showing adaptations to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in desert ecosystems.
